Class Scratch

java.lang.Object
Scratch
public class Scratch extends Object
This is a demonstration class showcasing various JavaDoc features and annotations.

This class is designed to illustrate how to properly document Java code using JavaDoc comments. It covers all major JavaDoc tags and their usage patterns.

Since:
1.0

    • add

      public int add(int a, int b)
      Calculates the sum of two integers.

      This is a simple utility method that adds two numbers together. For more complex mathematical operations, see MathUtils.

      Parameters:
      a - the first integer value
      b - the second integer value
      Returns:
      the sum of a and b
      Since:
      1.0
      See Also:
      • subtract(int, int)
      • multiply(int, int)

    • divide

      public int divide(int a, int b) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Divides the first integer by the second integer.

      This method performs integer division. For floating-point division, please refer to Calculator.divideFloat(float, float).

      Parameters:
      a - the dividend (numerator)
      b - the divisor (denominator)
      Returns:
      the integer quotient of a divided by b
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if b is zero, as division by zero is not allowed
      NumberFormatException - if arguments cannot be parsed as integers
      Since:
      1.0
      See Also:
      • multiply(int, int)

    • parseNumber

      public int parseNumber(String str) throws NumberFormatException, NullPointerException
      Parses a string representation of a number.

      Converts the string argument to an integer value. The radix is assumed to be 10. This is a wrapper around Integer.parseInt(String).

      Parameters:
      str - the String containing the integer representation to be parsed
      Returns:
      the integer value represented by the string argument
      Throws:
      NumberFormatException - if the string does not contain a parsable integer
      NullPointerException - if str is null
      Since:
      1.5

    • isPositive

      public boolean isPositive(int number)
      Determines if a number is positive.
      Parameters:
      number - the number to check
      Returns:
      true if the number is positive, false otherwise
      Since:
      2.0

    • legacyCalculation

      @Deprecated(since="2.0", forRemoval=true) public int legacyCalculation()
      Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
      As of version 2.0, use modernMethod() instead. This method will be removed in version 3.0. The new implementation is more efficient and thread-safe. This method performs the old calculation that is no longer recommended.
      Returns:
      the calculated value using the deprecated algorithm
      Since:
      1.0
      See Also:
      • modernMethod()

    • modernMethod

      public int modernMethod()
      Modern replacement for the deprecated legacyCalculation() method.

      This method implements an improved algorithm with better performance and thread safety. It is the recommended way to perform calculations.

      Returns:
      the calculated value using the modern algorithm
      Since:
      2.0
      See Also:
      • legacyCalculation()

    • processStudent

      public boolean processStudent(String studentName, int studentId, char grade) throws NullPointerException, IllegalArgumentException
      Processes student information.

      This method handles the core logic for student data processing. For related classes and methods, see Student, StudentProcessor, and the package documentation at ..

      Parameters:
      studentName - the name of the student to process
      studentId - the unique identifier for the student
      grade - the academic grade of the student
      Returns:
      true if the student was processed successfully, false otherwise
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if studentName is null
      IllegalArgumentException - if studentId is negative or grade is invalid
      Since:
      1.0
      See Also:
      • Student
      • StudentProcessor
